sources.autograph: Berlin, Deutsche Staatsbibliothek, M.564, 'Quartetto II' (for title, see No. 183)
ms_copies_parts: Berlin, Deutsche Staatsbibliothek, M.569 and M.570. Two copies made in Berlin for Frederick William II
Modena, Bibl. Estense, Mus. F. 91 (for title and comment, see No. 183)
later_editions: Paris, Imbault (Op. 26), no. 1 of 'Sei quartetti per due violini, alto e basso composti del Signor Luigi Boccherini di Lucca virtuoso di camera e compositor di S. A. R. Don Luigi Infante di Spagna, Opera XXV1. Libro quinto di quartetti. Prix à Paris et la province, port franc par la poste. A Paris, chez Imbault rue Honoré au Mont d'or n° 200 de la section des gardes francaises, entre la Rue des Poulies et la maison d'Aligre et Péristile du théâtre de l'Opéra Comique rue Favart n° 461.'

entries.notes: Some copies have the name and address of Imbault pasted over the name and address of another publisher (Le Duc). The edition was perhaps produced by Le Duc and then immediately taken over by Imbault.

partial_notes: Page starts with continuation of general information about string quartets and later edition details for Op. 26
